alert.note: Alert for Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 11:15PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTY THROUGH 1145 PM PDT... At 1115 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hillsboro, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Forest Grove, Banks, Cornelius, North Plains, Buxton, Gales Creek, Manning, and Rockcreek. This includes the following highways in Oregon... U.S. Highway 26 west of Portland between mile markers 45 and 63. State Highway 6 between mile markers 41 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area
